meanings.definition: Exploiting a loophole in a system or law to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: She was loopholing the tax code to pay less.
meanings.sent2: The company was caught loopholing regulations to save money.
meanings.sent3: The kids were loopholing the bedtime rule by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: He was loopholing his way through the maze of bureaucracy.
meanings.sent5: The detective caught the criminal loopholing his alibi.

meanings.definition: The act of finding and using a loophole to avoid a rule or regulation.
meanings.sent1: His loopholing of the contract terms was clever.
meanings.sent2: The loopholing of safety measures led to accidents.
meanings.sent3: The student's loopholing of the exam rules was creative.
meanings.sent4: Her loopholing of the parking restrictions was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The politician's loopholing of ethics guidelines was concerning.
